mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: The script by Tim Herlihy and Timothy Dowling gets relaxed, throwaway laughs, even if it doesn’t always hold together.
Pixels is a blast of energetic fun.
Pixels is a slice of pure, frivolous entertainment that doesn't try to overreach.
it’s not as original as it wants to be, despite having the able Chris Columbus in the director’s chair.

The visual effects are impressive, and there is a certain kick to seeing the human characters dodging barrels in a life-size Donkey Kong. But we don’t really care about the humans; here, at least, Q*bert is more endearing than Adam Sandler.

With a novel idea at its center and some good jokes scattered throughout, Pixels is a relief from the self-serious action films that invade movie theaters at this time of year. For most of the way, it’s good enough to enjoy, and for the rest of the way, it’s good enough to root for. But ultimately, it’s not quite good enough ... to be good enough.

Pixels has a few inspired action sequences and a handful of laugh-out-loud moments, but overall the special effects are surprisingly average — and the lazy acting by Adam Sandler, the shameless mugging by Kevin James and the hammy performance by Brian Cox don’t help. Not even Peter Dinklage in a mullet can save the day.
Sporting a flowing mullet and aviator shades, Dinklage perks things up considerably as the story’s comically arrogant bad-boy-turned-good-guy.
Even on its own silly terms, Pixels is not a very good movie; it’s painted up like a Ghostbusters-style fantasy-comedy but plays like so many slapdash Happy Madison productions before it.
Pixels is a casually sexist, awkwardly structured, bro-centric comedy, starring some of Sandler’s buddies. The only difference this time is that state-of-the-art CGI has been added to the mix.

If Sandler can’t find it in himself to be verbally or physically entertaining on set, you start to wonder why he’s there in the first place, although his hollow stare in a number of scenes suggests he may be pondering the same thing.
On this evidence, maybe the eighties weren't so great after all.
The truly mystifying thing about the movie is how desperately it caters to Gen-X junk nostalgia without bothering to think that maybe those Reagan-era kids have grown up a bit.

At isolated moments a tolerably amusing send-up of alien invasion disaster movies in which the attackers are video arcade-era renegades arrived to gobble up as many famous landmarks as possible, this one-note comedy runs out of gas within an hour (it is based on a short film) and should have been trimmed to a neat 90 minutes.
When one considers how good this material might have been if placed in the right hands, to see it squandered this way makes it almost more painful to view than the typical Sandler stinker.
Pixels may feel flatter to kids of the ’80s than it does to moviegoers too young to have known Pac-Man from Ant-Man.
Long before you’ve gotten a nickel’s worth of entertainment out of this dumb, unfunny flick, you’ll be wishing for the flashing sign that says “Game over.”

The 3D adds little, and the hallmarks of the Chris Columbus directing style are unevenness and luck. With a little of the latter, this could be a huge hit. But with a better star, sharper script and more Dinklage, it could have been a champ.
Lazy humor and familiar plotting aside, Pixels at least gets a little mileage out of its affection for the 1980s.

Neither Sandler nor his listless writers (too many punchlines just sit there and collect flies) seem invested. Whether he’s saving the planet or putting the moves on Michelle Monaghan, Sandler can’t be bothered to raise his pulse above comatose. If he doesn’t care, why should anyone else?
Basically it's Ghostbusters meets Wreck-It Ralph, without the sustained charm or wit of either.

Some movies are so interminable that it seems they might never end, while others are assembled with such indifference that you are essentially left waiting for them to start. Pixels somehow manages both.
For a movie that’s supposedly about delivering weightless, uncomplicated fun, Pixels is an overwhelmingly sad experience.
Even though it’s fair to say that Pixels is on steadier ground than most of Sandler’s recent comedies, the film is nevertheless flat-footed and grows tedious after the first hour.

The "characters" vary from slightly annoying to unbearable - this is a film in which a viewer can be forgiven for rooting for the old video game icons to annihilate humanity. God help us if the best savior we can muster is Sandler.
Yikes! I saw Pixels as a 3D metaphor for Hollywood's digital assault on our eyes and brains. Not funny. Just relentless and exhausting.
I think Sandler's miscasting leads to a real deficit of energy at the center of the film, and then the conceptual misfire is so dire that I just don't know what to say beyond that.
This is a Happy Madison production, and as such it's exhaustively lazy, outside of its righteous dedication to the valorization of the man-child.
A movie like Pixels should be stupid and energetic, not stupid and lifeless.
Here's a shocker: In Pixels, his latest, Adam Sandler plays a stunted man-child who turns out to be very, very special.
Pixels is ultimately a thoroughly numbing experience, not least because all the characters are doomed by a psychological flatness more two-dimensional than any arcade-game screen.

Where Sandler once exulted in our outrage (and frequently, our laughter), he now seems barely capable of mustering enough effort to carry a scene, let alone advance to level 255 of “Galaga.” There’s no joy left in his shtick.
Pixels is a movie without wit, without jokes, with nothing to say but plenty to regurgitate.
It stumbled onto an accomplishment truly awe-inspiring: It makes “Battleship” and “The Watch” look good.

There are legitimate excuses for going to see Pixels. Losing a bet, perhaps. Having a loved one held for ransom. Maybe a serious blow to the head. But none of those (except maybe the last) would allow you watch and actually enjoy the latest cinematic leavings of Adam Sandler.

As a bad movie, Pixels is extremely dismissible. The ways in which it is bad are hardly fun to pick apart, a la "The Room;" instead, they're just banal — the deeply predictable plot, the unfunny jokes, the constant low-level sexism and occasional spikes of racism that permeate the story.
Every joke is lame, every special effect unspecial.

mc_user_reviews.text: The impressive special effects and the videogame nostalgia can't save Pixels from being a boring, unfunny, predictable, plot hole filled mess from start to finish. And Kevin James is president? Seriously?

Not going to even bother giving my pros or cons with this film because everything sucks in it. Adam Sandler continues to ruin everything he touches. He's lazy, boring, and needs to leave hollywood now. Horrible casting choices (Kevin James has no place as the President in any universe), terrible plot considering the concept, and an overall disgrace to video games. Worst film I've seen in 2015 without any doubt in my mind.

Suffice to say, Pixels isn't worth the price of a 3D ticket, despite its handful of colorful action sequences. (The conversion is actually decent, though it is flat in spots.) While the basic premise of the movie is a good one, Sony and Happy Madison's take on the material is laughless and insufferably dull. In the end, you'd be better off spending your quarters at an actual retro arcade.

In all honesty this movie is probably more like an 8 but I felt it should get a bump for all the hate that it is receiving.  I took my 3 children, 13, 5, and 3 and they were all extremely entertained.  I too thought the movie was pretty damned funny.  There were very few moments when I was not laughing.  It was an original and entertaining story with plenty of laughs and action.  Adam Sadler, Kevin James, and Josh Gad were all funny, and I usually do not find Kevin James tolerable, and Peter Dinklage is absolutely hilarious.  In closing I thought it was an all around enjoyable movie and, to be honest, the best of the summer blockbusters so far.

Pixels can merge comic scenes and action of a very simple but great and by far one of the best movie of Adam Sandler , special effects are to be congratulated , performances could be better but they are good ... fun for the whole family and a certain sense of nostalgia .
I expected it to be terrible and surprisingly, It wasn't. Sure it wasn't the best plot wise but the good amount of comedic moments through out sort of made up for it.

Yet another 80s type movie albeit this one is not as over the top as the others trying to play on the popularity of the decade. For the most part, the movie was very boring. The dialog is simply uninspired and feels somewhat forced. The romance edge took up a lot of screen time and was not good at all. It should have been left out or less emphasized. The comedy was slapstick as always however it didnt connect very well in this movie. I did laugh about 3 or 4 times but it wasnt like some of the laughs I had in other comedies. The plot was non-nonsensical in that there was no adversary characterization except for a few words that Q-Bert made about his race. Anyway, its not the worst movie on earth, but it most certainly is below average by my book. I would skip it.

Não é tão ruim assim. Tudo bem que não é o melhor filme do gênero, não tem um ótimo ótimo roteiro ou as melhores atuações, mas o humor e efeitos especiais fazem o filme funcionar. O humor do filme é em bom tom e não tem apelação, fazendo dele um filme chato para os amantes de "comédias sujas". Talvez por isso o filme não tenha agrado o público, por ser um filme mais pra família do que pra assistir com os amigos.

WOW...is there even a point to coming up with different names for any of these Happy Madison productions anymore? Seriously...every movie is the same movie as its predecessor... this could have been called Grownups 3 for all the difference it would have entailed ...same characters, actors, plots....
So I just saw Pixels and it was pretty terrible and are you seriously surprised about that.

Someone somewhere has noticed that retro style games on your phone or computer are popular and that Ready Player One sold bucketloads and 'nostalgia' is cool. Only problem, that person is an idiot who made a brainless kids movie aimed at 10 year old retards when actually the real audience is 30 and 40 somethings who actually played pacman.

Pixels may have great special effects but the characters are unlikable and annoying, the jokes are wildly unfunny, the film has one of the worst written scripts i have ever seen and is just a very dumb film.

Video games really don't have a good reputation when it comes to having film adaptations. Sure we have a few good one's like Wreck it Wralph or Scott Pilgrim, but for the most part they seem to go down the same route as the Super Mario Bros movie where the film loses all the charm that made the game enjoyable to begin with. Part of the reason for this is they always seem to be put into dreadful hands. This time those dreadful hands are Happy Madison Productions, Sandler's film studio that have been producing his cinematic turds for 15 years now. And once again they have produced another insulting comedy, lacking any real charm and being light on laughs.

To be serious this movie sucks. The Tom and Jerry Movie is better than Pixels. Foodfight is better than Pixels. THE ROOM, often regarded as the worst film of all time,is better than Pixels. Heck even Chris-Chan's effortless Sonichu comics are better written than Pixels. To sum it all up, ANYTHING is better than Pixels.
Ignore all the **** Sandler apologists in the user reviews. This film is as dead and numb as Sandler is in that photo where he flashes the peace sign.

Pixels is stupid, unfunny and poorly made. There are plenty of merits to the movie, the action is okay, but it's ruined by sexism, terrible humor, Qbert and... Adam Sandler. It's cinematic filth and I wouldn't see it.

I know some bad comedies, like Ostin Powers, Silence of the Lambs and A Space Travesty - but those movies are pretend to be bad comedies, therefore they are funny. Pixels is a bad comedy while pretend to be fantastic movie, therefore not funny at all. The idea is new, I grant it, thats why I bought tickets for the movie - game characters in real world? That should be funny. Should be, but it was not. My advice - dont watch it, waste of time.

Of course, this movie is going to make tons of money. That's what Adam Sandler movies do now. They make money. Although the movie has some neat special effects, and a few very brief funny moments, but, the movie overall is just terrible. Sandler looks tired and bored throughout the whole movie, you can visibly see that he doesn't care anymore. He doesn't care.
How can you hate this movie?? Its got good jokes, good action sequences and good acting! It feels more like a 7/10, but for all its hate it deserves and eight.
This movie is another heap of garbage thrown on screen by Sandler to make easy money and kiss an attractive woman.  This movie is barren of laughs, and even ruins our childhood in the process.

though i'm not a big fan of Adam Sandler, I quite like his brand of humor. The longest yard, You don't mess with the Zohan, Grown Ups are all surely to my liking. But Pixels is just plain bad. The humor is just so unfunny, the storyline is lame and there is nothing likable in the movie, except for Qbert of course. Complete waste of money. I'm giving a rating of 1 because of the PacMan scene, which was quite good. Other than that, this movie is an 'epic fail'.

Hollywood’s hunger for the nostalgia dollar remains ravenous as ever and with ‘Pixels’ Sony leverage their longstanding relationship with Adam Sandler to deliver an epic sci-fi tribute to the 1980’s, so expect endless video game, music and general pop-culture references and if you were a teenager in the early 80’s there’s probably a lot here aimed at you.
i think  Sandler should give up his career pixels was awful, the story was very  rubbish and it has many other problems Adam Sandler acted very bad in this slumber movie
Leave your brain at the door and watch this movie, it's fun and it doesn't take itself seriously unlike all the critics who are slamming it for being fun.
How could anyone give this film above 3 is beyond me...

Well... There is so much lost potencial in this movie, A MEAN LOTS OF LOST POTENCIAL. I freking love with all my heart vídeo games but just putting pacman in a movie doesnt make it good, in my opinion, If you really love videogames, like me, you will find some enjoyment in this movie. (Its way better than smosh the movie at least).

Doesn't deserve all the hate its getting. I don't think anyone coming to see this movie should expect something elaborate and in depth, which is why I think it has so many negative reviews. As a gamer I enjoyed seeing some of the older characters in the film. The acting won't blow you away, but it isn't as bad as people make it out to be. Pixels definitely brought back some memories for me and while the jokes weren't outright amazing, it made me laugh more times than not. Give it a chance and don't judge it simply based on what you hear and read.

I don't know what people expected about this movie. It's underrated, it's a funny movie with good references to arcade games, it doesn't pretend to be anything else, if you don't like arcade or easy humor just don't see it.
The short film did it better.

Don't know why the hell critics hate Sandler so much. He's made some bad roles in bad films but Pixels isn't one of them. Yeah, the script is full of clichés and badly written dialogues and characters but it's a fun movie. It didn't aim to be a genius movie, it aimed to make us laugh and entertain ourselves and Pixels does it perfectly. Nostalgic and amusing, it's perfect for those who search for memories of old times with games and those who might even be interested in getting to know them. And come on, Sandler and Gad are hilarious and some jokes the movie makes with our society are quite good too. And to finish this review, there is a little orange character that will make you love him. Give a chance to Pixels, it's funny!
Just keep your finger on the fast-forward button until a videogame sequence, watch it, then fast- forward again until next videogame sequence and wach it.
Funny, Nostalgic, and NO bad Adam Sandler Moments.

Hollywood's exhaustive exploitation of well-known brands hits rock bottom with this absurd concept: Aliens interpret signals of classic arcade games as a declaration of war, so they attack us with giant destructive versions. Add the fact that it stars Adam Sandler and Kevin James and you're in for pure drek. The only thing to recommend this film is the cool destructive special effect that turns objects into glowing pixelated blocks. Otherwise, overacting, dumb dialogue and ho-hum action pile on the insults to our eyes and ears.

First of all, this movie is bad. But just how bad is bad? If this movie was a video game, it would be E.T. for the Atari 2600. Thats right, this should cause the collapse of companies, the sacking of entire departments, and should be buried out of shame. Its that bad. I struggle to even call this a movie, because what it devolves into is one of two things: Adam Sandler staring at the screen blanking thinking its hilarious, and the "actors" pointing at things and going "Oh look, its (insert game character)! Remember that?" Literally the only thing that keeps this movie from somehow making it into the negatives is Peter Dinklage. I remember him being in this movie alone sold me on the idea. Boy was that a mistake. Him being the standout actor is about as impressive as beating six year olds at chess. My recommendation? Stay as far away from this movie as possible. If you want to see colorful nostalgia of a more simple time of gaming, dont go see this movie. Dust off that ol' NES or SNES (or even resort to emulators if you have to) and experience the nostalgia as its suppose to felt. With a controller in your hand and no gaping mouthed idiots staring at you.

This movie was hilarious (just as all movies with Adam Sandler and Kevin James are) but what really was unique about it was the older video games and pieces of TV shows, and games from the 80s. My mom and Aunt were even talking about how this movie was there generation kind of movie. And when I watched it I didn't understand it as well as the my mom, aunt and uncle did which is probably why a few people are giving it bad reviews. Because it was a great movie. And Adam Sandler (who also helped produce the movie) all he wanted to do was bring back older video games that are now extinct and I think he did a great job!

I absolutely loved Pixels and I honestly don't know why there are so many bad reviews. First off, it's an Adam Sandler movie so yes, there is a lot of dumb comedy. But as a gamer who loves the classics, this movie may be my favorite in quite a while. I am one of those people who don't have much of a reaction during the movies. I had 1 "aw" moment during minions, and i rarely even flinch during horror movies, but Pixels had me smiling and at the edge of my seat almost the entire time. Sadly, I saw this movie at a drive-in theater so 3D wasn't an option, but it was such a great movie I'm going to a normal theater to see it again this weekend in 3D.

Nostálgico e divertido, pixels reúne vários elementos cinematográficos que são indiscutivelmente um colírio para os olhos, onde uma trama razoável e uma comédia suave são o suficiente para dar boas risadas.

First let me be perfectly clear, I grew up in the golden age of video games, so I am going to be naturally biased. The reality is, this game really is more for the nostalgic adults who grew up in the yester-years of video game history, they grew up in smoky arcades and spent late nights playing video games.

Is it any shocker that his latest movie is nothing more than the usual Sandler shtick? Unfortunately no. "Pixels" is just another Sandler fest with a bunch of arcade video games from the 80s. It's incredibly unfunny with some of the stupidest sub-plots in any Sandler movie in general. It's also got forced relationships between Adam Sandler and Michelle Monaghan and even Josh Gad and Ashley Benson. And Kevin James is just awful as the President. THE PRESIDENT! As far as the action sequences with the arcade games, they are fantastic to watch. The whole Pac-Man scene in particular is just outstanding to watch (if you ignore the idiotic comedy in between). But what's sad about "Pixels", a movie about arcade video games, is that they are barely in the movie. They probably only make up about 25% of the entire movie. The other 75% is focused on our terrible main characters, their childishly idiotic humor and their annoying sub-plots that have nothing to do with a movie about video games attacking earth. Overall, the fun action sequences are mostly pushed to the side thanks the movies terrible writing and crappy characters. I give "Pixels" a D-! Be sure to check out my YouTube channel "LittleMovieBoy for more reviews.

Forgettable Ghostbuster wannabe is unfunny despite it's good initial concept. One of its biggest problem is obviously Sandler himself, as his brand of humor is becoming obsolete.  It's not a flop due to its low cost, but tragically, its one of Sony's biggest hit in 2015...what an abysmal year for the studio.

Children of the 80's should get a kick out of the near-constant stream of references. Flashy special effects and some pretty nice action scenes make it the best looking Sandler movie to come out in a while. It is still very much a Happy Madison/Sandler film. That should tell you all you need know about the humor at this point. The jokes are immature and the whole thing is a huge celebration of the man child.

Pixels is the biggest piece of dog sh*t I have ever seen. It is cultural discrimination towards video games and Chris Columbus is the biggest retard in the world for directing this piece of f*ck! The acting is awful, the special effects are so obvious it would have looked better if you hung some cardboard over the camera, the story is incoherent and makes no f*cking sense and the cinematography (if you can even call it that) it the worst thing you will ever see in your life. Kill this movie with 5,000,000 atom bombs!

This movie was absolutely brilliant and the kiddies loved it. I enjoyed it so much but the hype wasn't worth it. It's more of a 7 but I will give it a higher rating because of all the flack it is getting that it doesn't deserve. Sad that such a good movie is being whacked like this.
Pixels review:

A great concept Sandlerized.  I really considered shutting this film off about thirty minutes in, but I held out a little hope for the video game characters.  The human characters were horribly written and horribly performed.  Sean Bean and Michelle Monaghan should fire their agents.  Seriously Kevin James as President of the United States makes the idea of Donald Trump look good.  I wouldn't spend a Quarter, a Dime, or a Penny to see this atrocity.  F

Hilarious and fun movie--ignore the unenlightened critics. I am not a fan of Adam Sandler, but he did a fine job portraying an aging, bummed-out guy who never was able to put his talents to use in life. I thought he was fine, nothing like the incompetent bumbling idiot that reviewers said of him--I DON'T UNDERSTAND THAT AT ALL. Kevin James was a hilarious POTUS. All I can think of is, too many Millennials reviewed this movie and don't freaking get it. So, they can go back to watching their Harry Potter and sparkly vampire movies for all I care. This is Gen X material.

First the computer animated "Wreck It Ralph", and now comes the live action/computer animated "Pixels"! Man, the movie was pretty cool despite the critics making some bad reviews about it. I mean, Donkey Kong, Pac-Man, Centipede and a whole lot of video game characters appearing in a war between the humans and the alien life-forms. I have to admit: You have to be a video game champion, but you cannot cheat. Best movie ever! :)

This movie felt like it was filmed with a camera on the shoulder of someone. The picture is horrible! The cinematography and special effects look like they were made with a free to download 3D maker software from a high school team class project! The acting is so poor that even Buzz Lightyear and Woody from Pixar's Toy Story have more EMOTION than Adam Sadler and the rest of the casting crew. The movie makes a decent try to reference the 80's through old time songs and even having a character dressed with jeans, spiky hair and ear rings similarly to the 80's fashion but the results end making him a parody (and no he was not meant to be a parody he was meant to be a cultural reference and they failed miserably on that).

Saw this movie today and it was GREAT.  It's funny as you scroll through as to WHY many didn't like it and most bring up Adam but very little about movie. Take out your tampons. These are the same pansies that use words like "trigger"  and "privilege"  and most important probably belong to a "group"  **** you and your group! Who the hell joins a group? bunch of losers. lol

Extremely UNDERRATED film. Of course there are many MANY flaws, including over-the-top loudness, flat jokes, and a plot that didn't quite make sense, but this is really not worth an 58% audience score on rotten tomatoes. I really don't get the hatred for this movie and why people hat Adam Sandler. This is really fun to watch with the family. Many jokes were flat and you can tell when the joke was supposed to make you laugh, but instead there was silence among the audience, but really REALLY this film is better than Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2.
Fue una película bastante entretenida. Con buenos efectos. En especial si la van a ver en 3D. No fue lo mejor que he visto pero me divertí bastante viéndola.

This movie was great!  The special effects were awesome and I loved the story.  I'm wondering if the people that wrote such negative reviews even really watched the movie?  Seems like a lot of hate for a movie that was funny and really enjoyable. Especially if you're old enough to remember playing the games its referencing. I guess that could be a problem for younger people. I loved it. I'll almost certainly see it again in the theater with my son.

Excellent concept but poor execution is the best summary i can give. Save your money for when hollywood inevitably makes the same film again with a different name,different people and better jokes, it wouldnt be hard to top this!
It's not really a 10, but it's also not the 0 or 2 that a lot of grumpy people are giving it.

The movie is a mess.  It doesn’t really work on any level.  The action is not that great.  The comedy is not really good at all.  The special effects don’t work.  It doesn’t really hit a market because it’s not Nerdy enough for Nerds, and the humour is way too juvenile so will only entertain fans of Adam Sandlers previous comedies or children and even then it will not appease Adam Sandler fans because the rating doesn’t allow them to do enough swearing or his usual lowest common denominator gags that somehow entertain people.  The 3D effects mean that the 2D version which I saw didn’t really work which will limit it’s appeal on DVD and the cast is either really awful or too over qualified for this film and poorly directed.  It’s just a mess on every level!! I didn’t find it very funny and I didn’t find it very thrilling.  I was just bored by it and I was glad to go.  It just doesn’t work on any level.  I am probably going to forget about it as soon as I have finished this review.  There are several continuity errors, plot holes and a couple of video game characters that were made after 1982 that turn up in the film un-explicably.  They just didn’t care!!
If, as the human race we have sunk to a level in which Adam Sandler is allowed to make such crap like this, and then charge people to see it; then we indeed deserve to be annihilated by aliens.

damn, Adam Sandler doesn't give a damn anymore. Just trash. LOL if you like this movie you are literally what is wrong with America. Used to be a big Sandler fan back in the 90's. he's jumped the shark multiple times now. Time to retire. Please stop paying to see his movies

For someone who loves videogames this is a great movie, i loved it, people just hate because of the games and Adam Sandler and that is just stupid, the movie is awesome, people just need to look with better eyes

well this is what we get, to of the worst things in Hollywood: new Adam Sandler movies , and video game movies, no one wanted this. its supposed to be for kinds but has nostalgia games most kids wont get this.  bottom line is sucks

This is an amazing movie with a lot  of visual effects. In my opinion is a great action movie. I dont understand why the critics are so bad. Really, if you think in a movie about video games, you must see this movie because is pure joy.
Most critic reviews can be summed up by pretty much being butthurt by the fact that Adam Sandler is in it, but if you can ignore the fact thats he's in this film it's actually pretty enjoyable.

I loved it, maybe you had to be a pre-teen/teenager during the 80's to appreciate it.  Based on allot of the garbage that has came out in the last couple of years this is in the top 20 percent or better

Peter Dinklage's bizarre, secretly angry performance is very enjoyable, but it does not redeem "Pixels" of its incredibly offensive, outdated view of the world. Still, not the worst Adam Sandler film.

This movie is absolute trash. The idea is horrific, and held together by a paper thin story that is full of holes and horrific acting. The climax in one of the most unoriginal and disappointing climaxes ever. The whole movie is just a **** mess of bad acting, bad visuals, bad jokes, bad, bad, bad, bad. I was literally offended as a gamer to see the way the gaming community was depicted as. If you plan on going to see this movie, do yourself a favor and kill yourself.

The whole film felt like an overblown idea given to the wrong production company. The original short film it was based off of was pretty damn good and I'd highly suggest watching that short video over this feature film.
Se você é realmente fã de old gaming, esse filme é um lixo pra você e pra mim, se você não é... também é ruim. Péssimo trabalho, filme pra gente idiota e que nem gosta de games

Pixels is a great movie not only for forty-year-old-men but for everybody. Those who grew up in 80s will love it without a doubt for familiar "characters", but others will find great family comedy. I have no idea why there is so much hate around this movie and Adam Sandler... I feel ashamed when i read some of reviews and i really don`t understand it... He did a great job making funny, nostalgic movie with very good video effects and good story. I loved it, my girlfriend liked it and my son also loved it. If you have any doubts watch it or not - YES, WATCH IT. Don`t listen to the critics - this movie is very good !

Pixels is a masterpiece, well just as long as you are in between the ages of 35 and 50. Not as good as the last retro arcade movie "Wreck it Wralph" but has more references to more games of that era. This should get an Oscar nomination if only because it accomplished one simple feat. It is a movie that involves Adam Sandler and it does not completely suck.
This was funny. My wife and I laughed at the strings of corny jokes. Our son enjoyed it. Unusually he can't even sit still in a movie theatre but for this one, he did.

Great movie! I quote Medeiro2014: "an awesome time so many references, they really close to the gameplay of centipede, pacman etc. i really hard with bad movies about videogames, this is a great movie i dont see another that made a good job referencing classic games. Some gamers platonic dreams made reality (videogame girls), competitions, nice visual effects, scenes where the gameplay of a video game matches with a movie is dramatic moment (10, 9, 8, 7....), Qbert, Duckhunt, etc. But if you wanna hate just for beign a nice sheep do it, for me was an awesome movie. i hope for more like a extended version or a secuel."

Great movie!I took my family to see it at the drive in and we all loved it it was funny and we all had a good te during Pixel!.......................................................................................................................

Short of a few plot holes, this movie was refreshing, visually looked amazing, and made me laugh a lot. It's a great homage to what once was. Most of the people giving the movie bad reviews have some misplaced hatred for Adam Sandler, and/or have not even watched the movie. It's worth it to see it in theaters.
Like most other Happy Madison films, Pixels is panned by critics despite it being hilarious. This movie is a must-see for any fan of retro video games.
This movie is more like a 7.5 out of 10, but it needs these scores to outbalance the ridiculous over-the-top scathing reviews.

Watching this movie because of Sean Bean and director I must confess liking it a lot. Funny jokes, good acting (surprisingly good), good script for alternative universe type. Nerd friendly movies are rare.

Although it seriously lacks in context and 'insanely hilarious' jokes, Pixels is certainly not as revolting as other critics have droned on about. In fact, I had quite a lot of fun with this movie. I liked the action and even some of the jokes did make me laugh! Yes! Adam Sandler made me laugh!!!!! However, I thought the ending was rather poor and there was a little bit of sexism in this movie too. But I gotta say, I would rather watch this movie than the third hobbit movie, I'm serious.
For a movie I would put it anywhere between 6 to 8. I have no idea why it got as many negative reviews as it did to be honest. I'll try to put out some bullet points about good/ bad:

It's not perfect but it is damn hilarious. I came out with jaws aching because I had laughed so much! This was really one of the best films I have seen recently, and I don't see why all of these negative reviews are here. The story is admittedly fairly mediocre, but the animation style was really unique, and, as a gamer myself, it never felt insulting or stereotype-ish (if that's a word). Also, that Pac-man scene is soooooooooo cool! I think this may end up in the lost land of good movies that relate to, but aren't based on, video games- along with Wreck-it Ralph. Some of the soundtrack mixes are pretty sweet too!

Chris Colubus' 1492 Pictures teams up with Adam Sandler's Happy Madison to give us Pixels. A film about 80's video game nerds who team up to save mankind from an alien attack with video game characters as weapons.

What were people expecting from this? Yes, it's dumb. Yes, some of the jokes are a tad too lowbrow. But it's still Adam Sandler's most entertaining film in years. The visuals are good, the concept is fun and the cast (particularly Peter Dinkleage and Josh Gad) are clearly committed. Obviously, there are flaws. Some of the gags miss the mark, and not all of it is entirely plausible. But for all its shortcomings, Pixels is a decent film with some funny ideas and flashy visuals.

I'm not going to claim this movie is a literary masterpiece by any means but if you go in to enjoy it for what it is (an action/comedy movie geared towards gamers) you will have fun and enjoy it on some level. I personally enjoyed it quite a bit, but I'm also a big Adam Sandler fan and was a fan of the premise of the movie.

So, Pixels. The movie that got so much hate from critics just because it has Adam Sandler in it, but please everyone, don't listen to the reviews. The script is perfectly written, the acting is incredible, the special effects are awesome, Peter Dinklage's character is amazing, you get the picture. Give Pixels a chance.

After seeing all the negative reviews, I was somewhat reluctant to see Pixels. Regardless, I did so and was pleasantly surprised. The references to 80's video games are all over the place and make a video game fan like myself revel in the joy of its immense premise. In addition, the plot involving familiar arcade characters attacking Earth works better than I thought it would; something about Pac-Man eating vehicles provided, for me, some sort of twisted humour. The film has its flaws, and arcade fans may get more out of it than other groups, but for me, it was a blast to watch.

Movie was funny. And IMO better then ant man. You can't go wrong with some of the jokes you will be telling your coworkers later. People bashing the movie are probably the same that hate family guy, or find stand up comedy "problematic"

As far as movies are concerned, If the "critics" hate a movie, I will go watch it because it usually means that the movie is pretty good. If the "critics" love the movie, I usually skip it because the movie is not very good. This is a perfect example of this. I took my 10 yr old son with me to see it. This movie does exactly what I think movies are supposed to be for. It entertains. It was moderately funny for me, at no time did I have a deep belly laugh, but I did laugh and smile throughout the movie. My 10 yr old though, he loved it, big hearty laughs were plentiful from him. This movie does not have some deep secret meaning of life or supposed to teach you the way of the world. It does exactly what it was meant to do, give a laugh and entertain for an hour and 40 minutes. I thought Josh Gad was pretty good in this as was Kevin James. Sandler and Dinklage were ok as well. I grew up with these old games and it brought back some good memories and actually got my son wanting to find these older games online and play them. He is still playing donkey kong. If you have a free afternoon, take your kid and enjoy a good movie and walk down memory lane. Go see it.
is a movie great and fun,has appearance of several classic characters, has moments of cool action and view an invasion of something I love so much in our world is really unbelievable

My girl & i see the movie, just have an awesome time so many references, they really close to the gameplay of centipede, pacman etc. i really hard with bad movies about videogames, this is a great movie i dont see another that made a good job referencing classic games. Some gamers platonic dreams made reality (videogame girls), competitions, nice visual effects, scenes where the gameplay of a video game matches with a movie is dramatic moment (10, 9, 8, 7....), Qbert, Duckhunt, etc.  But if you wanna hate just for beign a nice sheep do it, for me was an awesome movie. i hope for more like a extended version or a secuel.
Adam Sandler is on a downfall so far since Grown Ups 2. Pixels was somehow a good movie. The humor is a little funny the visuals looked childish. Also Adam's friend is in it Kevin James.

Pixels is no where near as bad as people are saying it is but it is a major disappointment. Chris Columbus is a fairly reliable director and has managed to create some great comedies and some strong blockbuster films as well but once again it just feels like Adam Sandler directed this. I am not an Adam Sandler hater, but I am getting sick of the same story that he crafts year after year. The visuals for this movie were great but I was mixed on the characters. Josh Gad was funny from the start but he got old quick. Peter Dinklage was so bad, he was not funny at all, I was expecting him to be really funny but he just became this mess with a terrible accent. Then you have Kevin James and Adam Sandler who are just not believable in their roles. Pixels may be one of the most original stories of the year and I did find it sort of funny at the beginning but the writing for this film is predictable and falls into the same Sandler template. This film is just destined to become a Sunday afternoon cable movie.

Personally, this movie wasn't as bad as people were making it out to be. I did find it a bit hard to get into it at first, there were quite a few boring (and some sexist) jokes, and I was bored for a good half hour or so. I also feel they could have done better with the transition into action, because I felt they went from 0 to 100 pretty darn fast. One thing as well that really bugged me was the relationship between Violet and Sam, because one minute they hated each other, the next minute they're in love. I personally did not like how they executed their relationship, but if you like relationships like that then its cool. Honestly though the best part comes when the action starts, and boy was it cool! I enjoyed watching the main characters battle it out with some of our favorite classic video game characters, and you really feel the intensity of the situation when VonLichten comes on with their mix of 'We will Rock You." so I really enjoyed the climax to the end of the movie. So I feel its definitely worth checking out, but if you're someone who can't handle slow starts to movies, maybe get there later or just wait for it to come out on DVD and fast forward until the good parts.

Why are critics always complete idiots? Great movie! Funny, entertaining and a great way to mock the sci-fi genre. I would watch this movie again! I'm guessing the critics have a hard time enjoying anything in life. Maybe it hurts them to laugh, love and have fun?

Pixels is filled with 80's nostalgic aimed for adults but it the film is really mean't for kids and it's a typical Adam Sandler film were he has no charisma it's offensively lazy also he just wants to hang with his friends. The prologue is set in 1982, 13 year-old Sam Brenner (Anthony Ippolito) and his friend Cooper (Jared Riley) ride their bikes to a newly opened arcade, where Brenner comes and shows his skills mastering classic arcade games such as Pac-Man, Centipede, Tetris and Space Invaders. Cut to present day, where Cooper (played by Kevin James who was miss-cast) is a goofy unpopular president of the U.S, Brenner (Adam Sandler) is sad sack who wears a orange uniform and installs TV's and video games. Sam never really gotten over his defeat at Donkey Kong at the hands of showboating Eddie (played by Peter Dinklage) as a grown up, and Brenner can not get over it. Michelle Monaghan plays Violet a soon to be divorced mom, who is a high ranking weapon specialist. Josh Gad is Ludlow, a creepy love able gamer who lives in his mom's basement. Back In 1982, NASA sent a time capsule into space that included arcade games. The aliens misunderstand the videos and that took as a threat and declared war Pac-Man, Galaga, Donkey Kong send them down to Earth to destroy the whole planet. The talented director Chris Columbus (Home Alone 1,2 Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone) has no timing which makes this comedy awkward and not funny, the film does have inspiring action sequences. Sandler's writers Tim Herlihy and Timothy Dowling's script does have laugh out loud moments and pretty cool action scenes but the problems it's their script. Weak female characters and that's not odd because  Sandler has weak sexist characters in his comedies but it's not good. Josh Gad is screechy and thinks it funny if he's high  pitched and screams his lines. You don't buy the chemistry between Michelle Monaghan and Adam Sandler. Kevin James as the president? Wrap your minds around that one. The film can be funny at times but it's a typical lazy zero effort Adam Sandler film, not even the humorous Dinklage in a mullet can save it. Some okay performances and a great visuals. Grade C

This film is so bad I couldn't even make it all the way through to the end, at just over half way through I had had enough of the lame jokes, dull plot, wooden acting and a waste of a good idea. Its a shame as the concept was interesting and could have made a good fun movie, but the idea is completely ruined in this awful film. I'd say its not even worth renting.

This is not a good movie. The script is ridiculous and most of the actors either don't care or are hampered by the material. But it's a god*amn masterpiece compared to other Happy Madison films. I did make me laugh and enjoy the movie a handful of times. Granted the rest was crap, but I wasn't expecting to enjoy a single second so I was impressed it had any bright spots at all.
Realmente le daría sobre un 7 aprox. Pero hay muchos ceros de varios usuarios que no entiendo, y así contraresto un poco la nota.
I don't know why everybody so mad about this movie.

I really didn't hate this movie as much other people did . let's go to the positives . The concept was original and great . The VFX was great to watch. Pacman and Donkey Kong segments was thoroughly enjoyable and great . Kevin James and peter dinklage was hilarious. The movie did have so many problems. Some of the Jokes were so Dead. Adam Sandler and Josh Cade Ruins the Whole Movie. The Love Segment with Adam Sandler and michelle monaghan was Utter Garbage . The Biggest Problem with the Movie was the Shifting Tones after Every Few Minutes.
Coming up short in terms of both humour and story, Pixels runs out of lives well before the closing credits.

This movie was created in the deepest dimension of hell. If Adam Sandler is not an apostle of the Satan of films (Uwe Boll) and his right hand man (Shamalayn), I don't know who is.  This film is better than Jack and Jill but not by much.

Another lame movie starring Adam Sandler that looks different from the outside of what he normally does but the jokes, crudeness, and laziness are still present. Pixels stars actors that desperately needed a paycheck and it showed.
This is a terrible movie from start to finish. When Kevin James is the president of America, you know there is something wrong. It is boring, and the visuals are a mess for the eyes.

Pixels is undoubtedly, unquestionably one of the worst films of 2015...maybe even the decade. The humor is non-existent, the acting is bad, the characters are awful and VERY ANNOYING (I'm looking at you Josh Gad). Avoid this film at all cost, I'm begging you.
I enjoyed it because it reminded me my childhood.

Pixels is hit and miss. While the oddball premise is original and there are some laughs to be found, the film settles for mediocre jokes, uninspiring action, a predictable plot and over the top characters.

Though I'm a sucker for arcade nostalgia movies (like Wreck-It-Ralph), Pixels tries and spectacularly fails to make something out of a cast of washed-up comedians, creepy/gross humour that will never be funny, poor characterisation, and that Q-Bert joke at the end. I'll pass.

During this movie, I was like "Wow, how many culture references they make in this piece of garbage. And not even one hit the ground correctly". For real, "Pixels" is another flaming pile of **** coming out of an awful studio that I didn't wanna see in theaters. Not because I'm not a fan of the arcade games that this thing references, not because it's got Adam Sandler, not even because the latter and the terrible Kevin James team up. But because it's so **** obvious from the trailer that this film fails with its jokes. That PACMAN scene with his owner was so freaking annoying. "Oh please someone annihilate this stupid thing!". Whatever the writer was smoking when he was writing that particular bit remains a mystery.
Come on Adam its time to give up this was a pile of dog **** to be fair you have done worse but this was truly horrible you acting god it is just **** and something I never want to see again.
Just I saw the movie Pixels and am very bored. I honestly do not know why I think this movie will be less interesting because honestly does not offer anything interesting.

There's something decidedly tacky about this film. Not even the mildly effective visuals or Peter Dinklage can help save this not very funny movie redeem itself. I've got to learn to trust my guts and live up to the fact that I can't stand Adam Sandler (or Kevin James, for that matter). And what's with Josh Gad making these crappy comedies? Disney will take away his "Frozen" pass card.

Even though the premise is a bit dumb and of course it is yet another Sandler movie with his typical jokes, the movie itself wasn't that bad and had its fun moments (together with too dumb moments of course). Still, it's watchable and you don't want to switch it off. Good movie to pass your time.

Pixels is movie for all those gamers of the past who loved to play games such as PAC-MAN, Centipede, Donkey Kong, Space Invaders, the whole nine yards, but the games shown in the film are really the only things shining brightly here. As you could see, Adam Sandler's glory day are over because he was just horrible in this film, Josh Gad felt like Olaf jumped ships from Disney to Sony becasue all I could hear and see was Olaf, Kevin James was as funny as ever and Peter Dinklage did not belong here. With a lot cheesy dialogue and colorful visual effects, the film barley makes par.

In " Pixels " They was a totally nostalgic movie with the most popular video games that were created in the 80s , but very boring , and I can not explain that Kevin James is president ?, Jaj , sure Adam Sandler and Kevin James had this 2015 suchas the worst year of his life expectancy forgotten.

The rumor was - the movie is stupid. I checked it myself and - yes it's stupid. And you know what, I always considered the way to describe a movie as "just stupid" rather stupid. But here one hardly can add anything more. It is not hilariously stupid,  not ingeniously or inventively stupid, not shockingly stupid, not candidly stupid, not purposefully stupid, not casually stupid, not outrageously stupid, not elaborately stupid, not blatantly stupid, not aggressively stupid, not pattern-breakingly stupid, not terribly stupid, not provocatively stupid,  not even utterly stupid... It's just stupid.
Have you ever watched a movie just to make fun of it, and when you actually see the film it's ten times worse than you anticipated?  That's "Pixels" in a nutshell.
I....I just don't get it..........
This is the first movie that their credits is more enjoyable than the whole movie. I want to tell you just one more thing: Adam Sandler is the least of your problems watching this movie.
A great comedy film and comic relief, the action scenes and special effects are excellent, but the role of Adam Sandler is weak, but it's still a good movie.

This. Movie is terrible I'm not even going to go into more detail. This movie is just terrible the only good thing is that the effects were amazing.  That's it. The rest of it was just bad. Do yourself a favour and don't watch this.
Way better than I expected,Obviously not perfect but a fun movie,And critics saying this is the worse Adam Sandler movie havn't sat through Jack and Jill or Grown Ups 2
The movie is underrated.it features a great concept and great humour,and The cgi efects althrough not important,are AMAZING.Memorable characters.and why not,the maze chase of the giant pacman

They ruined such a great 2 minute short with an adaptation to an 106 minute movie of just basically cheesy Adam Sandler moments no one wants to see. How can you possibly love this Adam Sandler dump from the garbage department? I guess people love stuff like Q-bert peeing which is completely unnecessary and that's what I meant by ruining a great short by the magical hands of Adam Sandler. It's a poor man's version of Ghostbusters meeting Wreck-it Ralph and then ruining it with Adam Sandler's magical hands and his friends coming in too. You'll be better off watching the short instead.
A great comedy film and comic relief, the action scenes and special effects are excellent, but the role of Adam Sandler is weak, but it's still a good movie.
Really cool movie , the special effects are GREAT do not have to complain about the film , I recommend for all ages , especially for those who have played many arcade games
I'm surprised about the quality of this movie. It is fun.....not a masterpiece but it has his moments.
Adam **** Sandler - the horror of all **** awful comedy. He's the "root" of all evil, corruption, human stupidity, depravity. And in this film, he's such as douchey as he was in... well, y'know?
The best movie of games and Adam Sandler ,and comedy is best of 10 stars,movie for family and very good.

Oh god where do I even begin. your either going to love this movie or hate it.  Ok now let's start off with the positives. There were a couple times I laughed, The whole video games attacking earth was entertaining and the video game battle sequences were well done and for once Hollywood produced an original movie. OK that's it for the positives. Even though I laughed at a couple parts it was a pretty big mess from start to finish. The actin was mediocre, the script was bland and the whole idea of using women as trophies when they saved the world. BELCH. I watched this movie because I love old school aracde games and even though Adam sandler does not make good movies nowadays he has had a couple of good ones such as 50 first dates, bedtime stories, billy Madison blended and a few others. However his acting felt very flat and so did the rest of the cast. Predictable with a few entertaining movies does not save this movie from the mess it really is. Now I just need to ease the memory of seeing pixels from my head.

The special effects, great.  Other than that, nothing else.  Children are gonna like it, not because it's a good movie, but because of Pac-Man.  Not that funny, and if you want to see all the parts that were actually exciting in this movie, just watch the trailer.

So, I caught this movie at the theater last Summer (2015). Over the weekend I received my DVD and decided to watch it again. Again, mildly entertaining, Adam Sandler sleazing his way through another lazy role. Creepy ending. CGI effects were okay, but still mediocre compared to GOG or other Marvel releases. Story line was lackluster and plot holes everywhere.

This movie does fail in the comedy aspect a little bit, but I did admire how fun and clever the story is and how much fun I had with the action sequences, especially the Pac-Man sequence, that was pretty awesome!

Sadly, the film shows the passed-away video games that used to be the "Call of Duty, Plants vs Zombies, Dotta and Super Mario wii" of the 1970s, on the nowadays times. What a bad idea, with a dumb direction, ineptly story-telling, unremarkable characters, and some kind of predictable story. This could be a film enjoyable for the 70s game's fans, but not for not-retro people. (PD: Inloved this film's one of my favorites!!).

I had heard bad reviews about this movie but my 15 year old boy wanted to watch it ,all I can say is this movie was awesome ,the humour was spot on ,it was fast paced and took me back to my early Defender days. The actors got into their roles and had a load of fun making it. Its not going to win any awards but this all about a dad and his boy enjoying 90 minutes together and having a laugh. Fantastic movie!

"Pixels" es una de esas típicas películas de Sandler donde inicia como un incomprendido y termina siendo el héroe que todos quieren, partiendo de esa base ésta comedia carece de gracias, la trama es inconsistente y desperdicia de gran manera a Peter Dinklage.

Opening in 1982 we meet a young Sam Brenner who is pretty good at arcade video games. The classics, as an adult Sam (played by Sandler) likes to constantly say. So good is young Sam that he enters a video game championship where he eventually loses to the obnoxious & annoying kid, Eddie at the game Donkey Kong.
Deutsche Review - Kritik

Everyone I knew who saw this said it was kind of terrible but I was actually kind of partial to it. I really liked the cast and it was funny and weird and retro feeling it was cool to watch with the kids.

A solid film with visuals that impress, the film will only attract young viewers, and will leave adults wishing that they have never entered the theater. Not a big surprise, considering the many flops of both director Chris Columbus (Home Alone 2, Percy Jackson series) and Adam Sandler (Too many to count). But the film did have high hopes, and was a let down for many PAC-MAN fans.
I think this was one of the worst movies of 2015. The script went nowhere, the storyline went nowhere, and the movie tries to make this funny when it's actually not.
This movie has  instant classic potential! Of course, critics hated it because they  hate everything with Adam Sandler in it. Ignore the critics, watch the movie and form your opinion by yourself!
Without words. Very boring, exagerate, absurd, unnecessary of realizing, a complete drag.Nominated to 6 prizes Razzie, included worse movie, Pixels...
